p: It has been shown that these insects often move between swine farms (most often over a distance of up to 2â€“3 km), especially in periods of stronger winds, and thus can contribute to the spread of many diseases as mechanical vectors ( 25). However, cases of much longer displacement of up to 30 km have been documented ( 28). Flies that do not feed on blood can carry pathogens mechanically (on the outer layers of the body) or with faeces and vomit. In the case of flies with a stabbing mouthpiece feeding on blood, pathogens may be transmitted along with blood ( 25).
